content.prompt:
• The figure includes two rays forming an angle and a dashed vertical line segment. There is a note that the figure is not drawn to scale.
  • One ray is horizontal, pointing to the right. The ray is labeled Jody x mph.
  • The second ray has the same starting point as the first ray. The two rays form the angle labeled with a measure of pi over 6. The second ray has the label Charlotte 4 mph.
  • A vertical dashed segment is shown, extending from the horizontal ray to the second ray above it.
  • The intersection of the dashed segment and the horizontal ray is labeled as a right angle.

The figure shows that Charlotte and Jody are jogging from a common starting point such that the angle formed by their straight paths is π6 radians. Charlotte is jogging at 4 miles per hour, and Jody is jogging at x miles per hour. Jody’s rate is such that a perpendicular drawn from Jody’s position on her path always intersects Charlotte’s position. What is the value of x ?

choices.label: 4cosπ6
4sinπ6
cosπ6
sinπ6

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
